00001 #ifndef _ESM_CREA_H
00002 #define _ESM_CREA_H
00003 
00004 #include "esm_reader.hpp"
00005 #include "loadcont.hpp"
00006 
00007 namespace ESM {
00008 
00009 /*
00010  * Creature definition
00011  *
00012  */
00013 
00014 struct Creature
00015 {
00016   // Default is 0x48?
00017   enum Flags
00018     {
00019       Biped     = 0x001,
00020       Respawn       = 0x002,
00021       Weapon        = 0x004, // Has weapon and shield
00022       None      = 0x008, // ??
00023       Swims     = 0x010,
00024       Flies     = 0x020, // Don't know what happens if several
00025       Walks     = 0x040, // of these are set
00026       Essential     = 0x080,
00027       Skeleton      = 0x400, // Does not have normal blood
00028       Metal     = 0x800  // Has 'golden' blood
00029     };
00030 
00031   enum Type
00032     {
00033       Creatures = 0,
00034       Deadra    = 1,
00035       Undead    = 2,
00036       Humanoid  = 3
00037     };
00038 
00039   struct NPDTstruct
00040   {
00041     int type;
00042     // For creatures we obviously have to use ints, not shorts and
00043     // bytes like we use for NPCs.... this file format just makes so
00044     // much sense! (Still, _much_ easier to decode than the NIFs.)
00045     int level;
00046     int strength, intelligence, willpower, agility, speed, endurance,
00047       personality, luck, health, mana, fatigue; // Stats
00048     int soul; // The creatures soul value (used with soul gems.)
00049     int combat, magic, stealth; // Don't know yet.
00050     int attack[6]; // AttackMin1, AttackMax1, ditto2, ditto3
00051     int gold;
00052   }; // 96 bytes
00053 
00054   NPDTstruct data;
00055 
00056   int flags;
00057   float scale;
00058 
00059   std::string model, name, script,
00060     original; // Base creature that this is a modification of
00061 
00062   // Defined in loadcont.hpp
00063   InventoryList inventory;
00064 
00065     std::string mId;
00066 
00067   void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string& id)
00068   {
00069     mId = id;
00070 
00071     model = esm.getHNString("MODL");
00072     original = esm.getHNOString("CNAM");
00073     name = esm.getHNOString("FNAM");
00074     script = esm.getHNOString("SCRI");
00075 
00076     esm.getHNT(data, "NPDT", 96);
00077 
00078     esm.getHNT(flags, "FLAG");
00079     scale = 1.0;
00080     esm.getHNOT(scale, "XSCL");
00081 
00082     inventory.load(esm);
00083 
00084     // More subrecords:
00085 
00086     // AIDT - data (12 bytes, unknown)
00087     // AI_W - wander (14 bytes, i don't understand it)
00088     //    short distance
00089     //    byte duration
00090     //    byte timeOfDay
00091     //    byte idle[10]
00092     //
00093     // Rest is optional:
00094     // AI_T - travel?
00095     // AI_F - follow?
00096     // AI_E - escort?
00097     // AI_A - activate?
00098 
00099     esm.skipRecord();
00100   }
00101 };
00102 }
00103 #endif
